metadata.Title: CVE-2020-13757 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Python-RSA before 4.1 ignores leading '\0' bytes during decryption of ciphertext. This could conceivably have a security-relevant impact, e.g., by helping an attacker to infer that an application uses Python-RSA, or if the length of accepted ciphertext affects application behavior (such as by causing excessive memory allocation).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-13757` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python3-rsa - 4.8-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python-rsa package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8-1').
